ratings.question_text: The readings/cases/textbooks used in this course were __________ .
Out-of-class assignments for this course were ___________ to my learning.
The workload for this course in comparison to other courses was ___________.
The pace of this class was ____________ for optimal learning.
Overall, the teaching assistant for this course was accessible, organized, and able to explain concepts clearly and thoroughly.
Field trips were well designed and ran smoothly.
I learned a lot from field trips.
How clearly does the instructor provide explanations of conceptual material?
How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Please identify the teaching assistant with whom you interacted most closely _____________________ .
comments: Instructor: Tamar Makov  Emily Grady
Instructor: Tamar Makov  Tamar
Instructor: Tamar Makov  Emily Grady
Instructor: Tamar Makov  Emily Grady
Instructor: Tamar Makov  Emily Grady
Instructor: Tamar Makov  Emily Grady
Instructor: Tamar Makov  Tamar
Instructor: Tamar Makov  Tamar Makov
Instructor: Tamar Makov  Emily Grady

narratives.question_text: What were the strengths and weaknesses of your teaching assistant
comments: Instructor: Tamar Makov  Strengths: she is super organized and responsive to e-mails.
Instructor: Tamar Makov  Always had good attitude and willing to take time to explain.
Instructor: Tamar Makov  Very responsive and helpful! Always reached out to us in time and reassured if we needed help or assistance. Thank you for your great work.
Instructor: Tamar Makov  help us coordinate communication with professors, teach for lab section and give critique for homework

Instructor: Tamar Makov  Tamar was very helpful in assisting with the LCA homework assignment. Having her host a tutorial session was very beneficial to my learning, as this was my first time experimenting with the LCA software. It would have been nice for the TAs to be more engaged with the students on a regular basis. For example, there were many times that assignments were due in class that weren't mentioned by the professors and it would have been helpful for the TAs to send out a reminder.

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-14, if you wish
comments: I think the link between professional practice and industrial ecology theory needs to be bridged. However, overall, the class is a great introduction to industrial ecology, and I hope I can work to build that bridge to professional practice myself.
Professors should have more available time to meet and reply emails to students. More guidance needed.
This is one of the classes I wish more people will take in the future! I find it crucial to how we think and address environmental challenges and opportunities!!!
I hope to learn more comprehensive in LCA.

I guess my only comment would be regarding field trips. It's a real shame we don't have any during the whole course. I believe it could be really interesting to sum up some field trips that are related to the topics that are covered along the course.

I feel there was a disconnect in this class between the lectures and the out of class assignments. Rarely was a reminder given regarding an assignment's upcoming due date, and there never seemed to be much of a follow up discussion for the majority of assignments. For example, the only mention of the five page research project update assignment came at the very beginning of the class when all assignments were being outlined. When the actual due date rolled around, it had never been mentioned again in class, and the only place it could be found was buried in the syllabus. Most of the teams discovered the assignment was due only a day or so before the due date, and by the time we received feedback on what we turned in, we had already needed to move forward with the project the way we had outlined in the assignment. For the MFA assignment additional instruction was required by nearly every student in the class, yet the response from the teaching team was inadequate. After spending over ten hours on the assignment, I don't feel much more capable of utilizing the spreadsheet that was provided or performing an MFA than when I started the assignment.

narratives.question_text: What were the best aspects of this course?
comments: The IE project.

Great lectures - very divers and complete. Gives a great overview on all different topics industrial ecology addresses. the work & exercises next to class were very helpful - I would have liked to discuss them after completion and not just hand them in and get grade.
Provide the real chance to interact with real industry allowing you to gain professional and academic experience.

This course gave a very good overview of the issues and topics within industrial ecology, taught by one of the founders and legends of the field. The class projects were also a huge learning experience, and the generous funding available allowed for site visits that were immensely helpful and educational.
The combination of materials, ranging from lecture, small discussions and activities.
The wonderful professors and the great discussions we had.

The balance of lectures from Dr. Graedel and Dr. Chertow as well as from other guests was great. The team project was very rewarding as well, although I wish there had been more pre instruction on how to best approach such a consulting project.

narratives.question_text: What aspects of this course need the most improvement?
comments: The projects could have been assigned earlier, especially considering the budget. It would have been useful to start projects earlier and have standing meetings with professors for project updates and to communicate progress.
Instructors should have specific office hours. Consider identifying time frames to answer emails and provide guidance.
Discuss the class-exercises/homework after completion.

The assignments for the course could have been better integrated to allow for deeper learning. For example, the in-class debates were interesting, but they would have been more beneficial and interesting if the lecture following the debate picked up the threads from the debate, or if the instructors provided feedback on the content of the debates during class to foster class-wide discussion. In terms of the other assignments, the critical review assignments I felt were somewhat pointless; the Material Flows Analysis assignment was interesting but did not give students a real grasp of how to conduct an MFA from scratch; the LCA assignment was too basic to give students any sense of what a real LCA is like; the data analysis assignments were cancelled for whatever reason. I feel the assignments should try to give students more deliverable skills, with more guidance on the part of the instructors.
I really wish and think there should be field trips for this course.
Field trips!
Communication between the professors, TAs and students is inadequate.

narratives.question_text: Was the relationship between the course lectures and discussion/lab section
comments: N/A

I really appreciated the visit to Assa Abloy - would have been great if we could have had more field-trips. Else, the course lectures and discussions where very helpful and great to exchange and discuss among us and class-mates.
Yes, we had great discussions and debates.
Discussed in question 16

narratives.question_text: Discuss, if you wish, how this course fits into your overall program.  (Please feel free to describe how the course relates to your academic background.)
comments: This course was a great way to work on a project, with a client. It should be a capstone course.

My interest in business and environment makes me want to learn more of how we can integrate more system thinking into our business decisions and actions. Industrial ecology is one of the main ways how you think about system thinking & dynamics! It was a very insightful and highly interesting class which allows you to explore different tools, skills and topics around how to integrate environment and industry successfully!
The course provided me a deeper understanding to sustainability industry and how to quantify that part combining with business sector.
This course was a core requirement for my industrial ecology and green design specialization.
It's part of my foundation since I'm focusing on Industrial Ecology in my studies.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: I took this course because of Marian Chertow and Tom Graedel. They're great teachers and I wanted to learn from them.
Relevant to my career path.
See response above.
The course is very important for my career goal
I took this course since I am following the industrial ecology and green design specialization, and it was a last opportunity to take a class with Tom Graedel.
I work for the CIE and am very interested in the field.
My interest in the field of industrial ecology and the presence of great professors.

narratives.question_text: Did the knowledge/skills that you gained from the course meet your expectations ?
comments: Yes

Yes and no. I gained knowledge of my particular project area, and learned how to deliver a project to a client with very little involvement. However, I did not necessarily get to apply specific IE methods that we learned in class directly to our project--which leaves me questioning, "what do industrial ecologists actually do in the workforce?
I have a general idea of the concepts, so yes.
yes definitely! great class! thank you so much!
I had been exposed to many of the concepts in this course from the LCA course in the fall semester, so the concepts weren't entirely new, but it was still nice to get a broad overview of the field.
Yes

Although I was exposed to a wide variety of industrial ecology analysis approaches and theoretical frameworks, as a consequence, the course seemed very surface level. It almost seems like there would need to be a two class series to reach the level of detail that would have met my expectations.

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: We had a highly-functioning team, and I am very proud of our final deliverable. If we could have started the group project earlier, then it would have been a bit better to coordinate our spring break research trips together.
Projects should be assigned really taking into consideration the background of the student and that it relates to their interests.

I had a great team and learned a lot from my class-mates. I think team-work is crucial and I thank you for this opportunity to explore new topics with "new" people so that we learn from each-other as much as we learn from the material we study and our professors.

Great idea, but the commitment from client should be more clearly understood prior to the start of the project. In fact, starting the project earlier than currently would be the best way, because these projects are huge endeavors.

The group was unevenly allocated. I was in charge of most of LCA part, which I think other members shall also be given a chance to practice with. There is also a communication issue and hard to balance everyone's opinion.

The class project was amazing, and I learned so much from doing the project (as much as the class lectures, if not more). It was an incredible experience to work with a real-life waste management company and observing how things work on the ground. Some disadvantages were that at times it was not clear what exact value we would bring to the client other than act as market researchers, and how we would apply industrial ecology concepts.

I enjoy group work generally, but my group was very small (3 people) and I ended up doing a disproportionate amount of the work. This is by no fault of the instructors, however maybe there should be a process for checking in on individual efforts.
It's been a great experience to work with amazing colleagues. The only issue is the difficulty we have in setting a time to meet, since we are always very busy.

The group project provided a nice way to attempt to apply the various forms of IE analysis in a real world situation. Language barriers within the group made dividing the work load fairly (such as drafting the report and interfacing with external clients) a challenge.

narratives.question_text: For students who might consider taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: Everyone should take this class
After each lecture, ask yourself, "how can I apply this in a job setting?"And if you can't figure it out, ask Marian or Tom to help clarify this point.

This is a great class which gives you a broad overview of industrial ecology and system thinking. Marian and Thomas are excellent professors. The exercises in class are very helpful and the final project gives you the opportunity to work on a subject you are fascinated about (the choice among projects is diverse and of high quality). Even if you are not interested in business/industry or material flow I highly recommend this class because it learns you to think in a systemic way about environmental solutions and opportunities instead of linear!!

The final project is most valuable part for me. If you just want to learn the basic info about industry ecology. Go ahead to borrow the book from library. It is not necessary to take the class if you just want to learn basic conception.

Industrial ecology is an amazing subject and field, and so if you have any interest in corporate/industrial sustainability or materials management or life cycle assessment or systems thinking, definitely take the course!
Very recommended course, just be prepared to work a lot!!
Pay close attention to the syllabus.
